templates.name: Can your products be used on kids?
templates.content: While our haircare products are thoroughly tested for safety by a third-party professional to the strictest of EU standards, we do develop these formulas for adult hair only, so they haven't been tested on children yet. We would advise consulting a physician before use so they can review the ingredient list. This information can be found on every product page, and I'm happy to help you find that if you need it.

templates.name: Are your products vegan?
templates.content: The majority of our haircare line is certified vegan, however, a small handful of products use animal-derived ingredients. Hydrolyzed keratin is utilized in vault color-lock leave-in conditioner; supernova and supernova blonde use an animal-derived polysorbate, and the shield contains an animal-derived popylene glycol. We're currently working towards being 100% vegan. I can also assure you that all our products are always cruelty-free!

templates.name: Where are your products made / manufactured?

templates.name: Are your products cruelty-free?
templates.content: Absolutely! We never have and never will conduct animal testing. When we create a product, we test it on ourselves, our friends, and anyone and everyone we can get our hands on! We test on people, never animals. To show our commitment to being cruelty-free, we have also been certified under the Leaping Bunny Standard.

templates.name: what is the difference between curl corps defining cream and curl corps gel?
templates.content: Curl corps gel lightly moisturizes, controls frizz, seals in moisture, and holds the definition of curls for a long-lasting style. On the other hand, Curl corps cream deeply moisturizes curls and enhances natural texture by encouraging curl formation. To get the benefits of both products, we recommend cocktailing them together and applying to damp hair before air drying or diffusing. Different hair types may get best results from different ratios of the cream and gel, so experiment with the combination that works best for you!

templates.name: How do I clean my Polished Perfection Brush?
templates.content:
The best way to clean your styling tool is with a lightly damp cloth, or to use alcohol wipes, in and between the bristles of your styling tool. Make sure to clean your tool when it is off, unplugged, and cool to the touch. It's important to ensure that product build-up does not occur on the bristles or body of the tool, especially if you're using thermally activated products like our Brooklyn Bombshell Blowout Spray, our Thicc Volumizing Base, or our Vault Leave-in Cream.

Build-up of these products on the bristles of your styling tool causes heat to become trapped against them whenever you're using the tool and can cause the bristles to deteriorate.

templates.name: Are your products silicone-free?

When we formulate products we determine whether silicones would be beneficial to the product. We are not always silicone-free, but we also don't see that as a bad thing!

templates.name: How do I clean my Hair Blow Dryer Brush?
templates.content:
Only clean your brush when it is off, unplugged, and cool to the touch. Start by removing all hair from the bristles - we like to use a teasing or 'rat-tail' comb to lift the hair up from the inner bristles out. If there appears to be product build-up, use a clean, lightly damp cloth or alcohol wipes to gently clean the inner barrel area and bristles. 

Lastly, remove lint, dust, and hair from the intake area at the base of the brush. You can use a firm-bristled brush to gently brush that away!

templates.name: What is the difference between Hydro Rush Shampoo and Kure Shampoo?
templates.content:
The Hydro Rush is a more intensive formula that is infused with hyaluronic acid and squalane. It gently cleanses and drenches hair with 3x more hydration. The Kure is a bond repair shampoo that is formulated to lather and strengthen damaged strands due to everyday stressors, heat or chemical treatments.

The Hydro Rush is ultra hydrating, reduces breakage upto 50%, and is ideal for dry, textured, or coarse hair types 2a-4c whereas The Kure has an innovative bond cure technology, includes plant butters + vegan proteins, and is ideal for all hair types 1-4c, high porosity hair as well as for those looking to strengthen their hair.

Both of them are free from sulfates, parabens, phthalates, mineral oil, and petrolatum. Hope this helps! :)
